Resource Description: Give your participants the support they need to make their relationships a success. This Virtual Mentoring eBook contains helpful tips and best practices, including conversation starters and a virtual mentoring preparation worksheet.

Help increase participation by marketing your mentoring program. This participant recruitment PPT template is completely editable so you can customize your message, add your logo, add your company name, include your MentorcliQ URL, and provide your own quote/photo from an executive sponsor, mentoring champion, or participant.

Resource Name: Using HRIS and SSO Integrations for a Connected Employee Experience
Resource Description: Create a more streamlined and user-friendly mentoring experience for your employees. This workshop video shows how you can do it by connecting your HRIS and SSO to MentorcliQ.
Looking to help people make quick connections that last a brief amount of time and focus on a specific learning need? Check out this video from David Peterka for the details you need to get started.
Help build a broader mentoring community through the use of mentoring circles. In this workshop video, learn what circles are and how to leverage them in your organization.
In this workshop video, learn how you can increase the match quality for your mentees and mentors by leveraging personality and other match science best practices.

Resource Name: Ask MQ Experts: Changes Coming for Mentoring
Resource Description: The MentorcliQ mentoring experts share their thoughts on where mentoring is heading in the coming years in this workshop video. The big spoiler alert: virtual mentoring and open programs.
Take a deep dive into MentorcliQ’s Strategic Mentoring Framework in this video. Learn how this approach can help you design a mentoring strategy that encompasses key areas of the employee experience.

Complete resource for getting started with a High Potential Mentoring Program. Guide includes: Executive Summary overview, Design Best Practices including match recommendations, Suggested Milestones, Communications, Example Participant Resources.
Use this fully editable PPT template to help you announce your Onboarding Mentoring program and share important information. Add your logo, photos, and specific information for additional context.
Ready to showcase your mentoring success? This workshop video guides you through the process of how to track, measure and prove the ROI of mentoring at your company.

Resource Name: MentorLab: The Power of Sharing Your Story
Resource Description: Get an inside look at the journey mentors will take during MentorLab training in this workshop video. See why it’s important to share your story in a mentoring relationship and how MentorcliQ helps.
An editable PPT template to help you announce your Sales Mentoring program and share important information. The slides are ready for you to add your logo and include additional context.
The Program Communications 1-page resource lists recommended communications for Technology Mentoring Programs. Communications are listed by recommended timeline and frequency.

The Example Resources guide is a helpful list of videos, articles and other digital resources categorized by Focus Area, which can be posted to the Program Resource page for Technology Mentoring Program participants.

Complete resource for getting started with an Open Mentoring Program. Guide includes: Executive Summary overview, Design Best Practices including match recommendations, Suggested Milestones, Communications, Example Participant Resources.
A fully editable PPT template to help you announce your Open Mentoring program and share important information. The slides are ready for you to add your logo and include additional context.

Resource Name: Finding the Right Success Metrics for You
Resource Description: This workshop video will help you identify and track the KPIs that really matter to the success of your mentoring programs: employee movement, engagement, diversity, and more.

Complete resource for getting started with a Finance Mentoring Program. Guide includes: Executive Summary overview, Design Best Practices including match recommendations, Suggested Milestones, Communications, Example Participant Resources.

This 1-page resource provides an overview of Women's Network Mentoring Programs and is a great asset to provide to internal stakeholders. It describes design best practices and who should participate as a mentor and mentee.

The Program Milestones 1-page resource provides a list of recommendations for Veterans Network Mentoring Programs. Milestones are listed by recommended timeline and identified as either assigned to mentees or mentors.

The Example Resources guide is a helpful list of videos, articles and other digital resources categorized by Focus Area, which can be posted to the Program Resource page for Reverse Mentoring Program participants.

This 1-page resource describes the foundation for designing Leadership Development Mentoring Programs. Design Best Practices include length of mentoring program, recommended match structure and rules, and example focus areas for this type of program.
The Program Communications 1-page resource lists recommended communications for Succession Planning Mentoring Programs. Communications are listed by recommended timeline and frequency.

Resource Name: What Are Mentoring Circles and How Do They Work?
Resource Description: This video featuring MentorcliQ’s David Peterka outlines the structure of mentoring circles, how they work, and when you would want to implement them.
A fully editable version of the Partnership Agreement to help program participants get started. The Microsoft Word file is ready for you to add your logo and include any additional context.

A fully editable version of the Closure Plan resource which provides participants ideas for their final mentoring discussion. The Microsoft Word file is ready for you to add your logo and include any additional context.

Resource Name: Mentoring Skills Learning Series – Finding Time for Mentoring
Resource Description: This resource for mentees and mentors, part of the Mentoring Skills Learning Series, gives your participants tips and ideas for how to be actively invested in their mentoring relationships. It includes advice for reinvigorating mentoring relationships and a practice exercise for participants.
